item.title: 私募股权通过转手燃气厂获利颇丰生产商竞相满足人工智能需求
item.description: 燃气发电厂，曾经不受青睐的投资标的，如今已成为私募股权的热门交易。【原文：Gas-fired power plants, once unloved bets, are now a hot trade for private equity.】

item.title: 美国就业市场创下2003年以来非衰退年份最差表现
item.description: 美国劳动力市场正经历数十年来最糟糕的招聘年份之一。【原文：The US labor market is coming off one its worst years for hiring in decades.】

item.title: Instagram高管将为平台辩护，此前其研究员称该平台是"毒品"
item.description: Instagram负责人亚当·莫塞里即将出庭作证，参与这场关于社交媒体成瘾的里程碑式审判。他将面对原告律师关于平台如何平衡安全与用户参与度的"尖锐质询"。【原文：Instagram boss Adam Mosseri is set to take the stand at a landmark trial over social media addiction and face a plaintiff attorney’s “very blunt questions” about how his platform balances safety and engagement.】

item.title: 依视路陆逊梯卡增长得益于元宇宙眼镜销售热潮
item.description: 依视路陆逊梯卡公司第四季度销售额激增18%，得益于人工智能眼镜需求的强劲增长，远超分析师预期。【原文：EssilorLuxottica SA reported an 18% surge in fourth-quarter sales, riding a boom in demand for AI-powered glasses that far surpassed analysts’ estimates.】

item.title: 希腊与土耳其领导人会晤后释放和解信号
item.description: 土耳其与希腊领导人经过在安卡拉的一天会谈后，均采取了和解姿态，这表明这两个历史宿敌之间近期缓和的紧张局势很可能持续下去。【原文：The leaders of Turkey and Greece struck a conciliatory tone after a day of talks in Ankara, in a sign that a recent easing of tensions between the historic rivals will likely continue.】

item.title: 立陶宛释放可能转向中国的信号以恢复关系
item.description: 立陶宛总理对中方恢复外交关系的诉求表示开放态度，标志着这个波罗的海国家与世界第二大经济体之间紧张关系可能出现转机。【原文：Lithuania’s prime minister signaled openness to a demand by China to restore diplomatic relations, marking a potential turn in the Baltic nation’s fraught relationship with the world’s No. 2 economy.】

item.title: 黑石将对冲基金种子投资业务扩展至600亿美元规模
item.description: 黑石集团正将其支持初创对冲基金的业务部门并入600亿美元的绝对回报业务板块，以此扩大规模，与那些为吸引交易人才而开出越来越大支票的多策略行业巨头展开竞争。【原文：Blackstone Inc. is moving its unit that backs startup hedge funds into the $60 billion Absolute Return business, giving itself scale to compete with the multistrategy industry giants writing ever-bigger checks to attract trading talent.】

item.title: 俄军袭击后 乌克兰核安全缓冲区濒临耗尽
item.description: 乌克兰警告称，在俄罗斯空袭破坏关键电力供应后，该国目前仍在运营的三座核电站已接近其最后一道安全缓冲线。【原文：Ukraine warned that the three nuclear plants remaining under its operational control are close to their last line of safety buffers after Russian strikes degraded key power supplies.】

item.title: 米其林计划斥资20亿欧元回购股份，同时推进聚合物业务
item.description: 米其林计划回购价值高达20亿欧元（约合24亿美元）的股票，这家法国公司正加速向聚合物复合材料领域扩张，以减少对陷入困境的轮胎业务的依赖。【原文：Michelin plans to buy back as much as €2 billion ($2.4 billion) worth of shares, as the French company accelerates its expansion into polymer composites to reduce its reliance on the struggling tire business.】

item.title: 第一鹰基金的米勒认为Brightline Rider收益将提振债券市场
item.description: 第一鹰投资管理公司市政部门首席投资官约翰·米勒表示，佛罗里达州Brightline私营客运铁路2025年底的客运量增长，对其陷入困境的债券而言是个积极信号。该公司持有Brightline的债务。【原文：Ridership growth on Brightline Florida’s private passenger railroad at the end of 2025 is a positive sign for its struggling bonds, says John Miller, chief investment officer for First Eagle Investment Management’s municipal group, which owns the company’s debt.】

item.title: 欧盟财长将讨论取消欧元在交易中的使用
item.description: 欧元区财长将讨论促进共同货币在发行和交易中使用的方案，这是该集团推动欧元在全球发挥更大作用、彰显欧洲金融独立性的举措之一。【原文：Euro-area finance ministers will discuss options to promote the use of the common currency in issuance and transactions, part of the bloc’s push to strengthen the euro’s global role and assert Europe’s financial independence.】

item.title: 俄罗斯袭击后，乌克兰国家石油天然气公司寻求债券偿还建议
item.description: 乌克兰国家石油天然气公司正寻求债务重组建议，因俄罗斯对乌能源设施的袭击加剧了该公司推迟偿付七月到期债券的可能性。【原文：NJSC Naftogaz Ukrainy is seeking debt restructuring advice as Russian attacks on Ukraine’s energy assets increase the likelihood it will need to delay payment on a bond due in July.】

item.title: 尽管加密货币基金遭遇抛售，发行商仍继续推进相关产品发行
item.description: 尽管加密货币遭遇暴跌，交易所交易基金（ETF）发行商仍在推进新申请，押注需求将在低迷期保持坚挺。【原文：Even as a brutal selloff hits cryptocurrencies, ETF issuers are pushing ahead with new filings, betting demand will hold up through the downturn.】

item.title: 加纳央行敦促贷款机构通过开发养老金市场实现公开化
item.description: 加纳央行正敦促该国金融机构通过发行股票并在股市上市，来利用养老基金的巨额资源。【原文：Ghana’s central bank is urging the country’s lenders to tap into pension funds’ huge resources by offering shares and listing on the stock market.】

item.title: 英国房屋建筑商股价因购房援助计划传闻大涨
item.description: 英国住房建设商股价上涨，此前有报道称政府正考虑推出新版已终止的"购房援助计划"。【原文：UK homebuilder stocks rose after a report saying the government is weighing introducing a new version of the discontinued Help to Buy program.】

item.title: 沙特巨型项目启动，阿美公司出售贾富拉油田原油
item.description: 沙特阿美公司首次出口其价值1000亿美元的贾富拉项目原油，这是该大型天然气开发项目首次有报道的出口。【原文：Saudi Aramco sold oil from its $100 billion Jafurah project in the first reported export from the massive natural gas development.】

item.title: 英国碳价暴跌，政治动荡加剧与欧盟基准价差
item.description: 英国碳期货价格暴跌，与欧盟基准价的价差扩大至数月来最大水平，政治不确定性和货币疲软令市场承压。【原文：UK carbon futures tumbled, driving the gap with the European Union benchmark to its widest in months as political uncertainty and currency weakness weighed on the market.】

item.title: 谷歌在搜索和Gemini聊天机器人中推出AI购物功能
item.description: 谷歌正在推出一项功能，让消费者在搜索引擎和Gemini聊天机器人中寻求人工智能驱动的答案时也能购物——这是该公司计划通过消费者的人工智能使用直接创收的一部分。【原文：Google is adding a way for consumers to buy things while seeking artificial intelligence-powered answers on search and in its Gemini chatbot — part of a plan to make money more directly from consumers’ AI use.】

item.title: 就业数据意外强劲，美联储降息之路面临挑战
item.description: 1月份就业数据意外强劲，降低了美联储在年中前再次降息的可能性，因为劳动力市场走势中最令人担忧的风险似乎已渐行渐远。【原文：Unexpectedly strong employment data for January reduces the chances the Federal Reserve will see a need to cut interest rates again by midyear as the most concerning possibilities for the trajectory of the labor market seem more remote.】

item.title: 美联储施密德称需维持限制性利率以抑制通胀
item.description: 堪萨斯城联邦储备银行行长杰夫·施密德表示，美国央行应将利率维持在"略显限制性"的水平，同时他持续对通胀率居高不下表示担忧。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas City President Jeff Schmid said the US central bank should hold rates at a “somewhat restrictive” level, as he expressed continued concerns over inflation that remains too high.】

item.title: 华尔街奖金助纽约市缩小50亿美元预算缺口
item.description: 据市长佐兰·曼达尼称，华尔街的奖金加上一项激进的储蓄计划，已使纽约市预计的两年预算缺口缩小了约50亿美元。【原文：Wall Street bonuses, along with an aggressive savings plan, has helped shrink New York City’s expected two-year budget gap by roughly $5 billion, according to Mayor Zohran Mamdani.】

item.title: 俄企争抢战争重压下的国家援助
item.description: 随着克里姆林宫因乌克兰战争面临不断扩大的预算赤字，越来越多的俄罗斯企业正排队申请国家援助和税收减免。【原文：A growing number of Russian companies are lining up for state aid and tax relief, just as the Kremlin is wrestling with a widening budget deficit from its war in Ukraine.】

item.title: 国会预算办公室因特朗普政策将美国赤字预测上调1.4万亿美元
item.description: 美国国会预算办公室周三再度警告称，美国财政状况正走向不可持续的道路，并将其对未来十年赤字的预测上调了1.4万亿美元——部分原因在于特朗普总统2025年税法及移民政策的影响。【原文：The Congressional Budget Office on Wednesday warned yet again that the US is on an unsustainable fiscal path, jacking up its estimate of deficits for the coming decade by $1.4 trillion thanks in part to President Donald Trump’s 2025 tax law and immigration policies.】

item.title: 强劲就业数据缓解消费者担忧，标普500指数直指历史新高
item.description: 周三美国股市上涨，交易员们对强于预期的就业报告表示欢迎。【原文：US stocks rallied on Wednesday as traders cheered a stronger-than-expected jobs report.】

item.title: 德意志交易所称并购活动未能推动欧盟市场发展
item.description: 德意志交易所集团一位高管表示，欧盟推动资本市场深化发展的举措，不应仅限于讨论交易所潜在的合并事宜。【原文：The European Union’s drive for deeper capital markets needs to look beyond discussions of potential mergers between exchanges, said a top Deutsche Boerse AG executive.】

item.description: 参与者寻找漏洞。【原文：Participants look for vulnerabilities.】

item.title: 加密货币亿万富翁趁比特币暴跌50%抄底
item.description: 瓦尔·瓦维洛夫是加密货币的早期采用者，他通过设计比特币挖矿硬件，在15年间将Bitfury打造成为业内最具影响力的企业之一。【原文：Val Vavilov was an early cryptocurrency adopter who built Bitfury over 15 years into one of the biggest players in the industry by designing hardware to mine Bitcoin.】

item.title: 农民与拖拉机齐聚马德里 抗议欧盟-南方共同市场贸易协定
item.description: 周三，数千名农民涌入马德里市中心，抗议欧盟的农业政策以及欧盟与南美国家集团签署的自由贸易协定。【原文：Thousands of farmers marched into central Madrid on Wednesday to protest against European Union’s agricultural policies and a free trade agreement with a group of South American nations.】

item.title: 比特币24小时交易风险飙升，华尔街沉睡时
item.description: 比特币持续数月的下跌掩盖了其全天候市场核心的变化：交易永不停歇，但稳定价格的流动性仍遵循美国市场交易时段。【原文：Bitcoin’s months-long slide has masked a change at the heart of its 24/7 market: trading never stops, but the liquidity that steadies prices still follows US market hours.】
